definitions.definition: To suffer decomposition due to biological action, especially by fungi or bacteria.
examples: The apple left in the cupboard all that time had started to rot .

definitions.definition: To decline in function or utility.
examples: Your brain will rot if you spend so much time on the computer, Tony!

definitions.definition: To (cause to) deteriorate in any way, as in morals; to corrupt .
To make putrid ; to cause to be wholly or partially decomposed by natural processes.
To spend a long period of time (in an unpleasant place or state).
examples: If I hadn't rotted in bed all day I would've come...

definitions.definition: To expose, as flax, to a process of maceration , etc., for the purpose of separating the fiber ; to ret .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To suffer decomposition due to biological action, especially by fungi or bacteria.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To decline in function or utility.
( ambitransitive ) To (cause to) deteriorate in any way, as in morals; to corrupt .
( transitive ) To make putrid ; to cause to be wholly or partially decomposed by natural processes.
( intransitive , figurative ) To spend a long period of time (in an unpleasant place or state).
( transitive ) To expose, as flax, to a process of maceration , etc., for the purpose of separating the fiber ; to ret .
